cab.content: SECRETDOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HER BRITANNIC MAJESTY^ GOVERNMENT)C. (61) 196 COPY NO. ^28th November 1961CABINETBERLIN: ECONOMIC COUNTER-MEASURESMemorandum by the Secretary of State forForeign AffairsAt Cabinet on 2nd November the Chief Secretary, Treasurythe Minister of Transport and the Fresident of the Board of Tradewere invited to inform me which economic counter-measures mightbe suitable for automatic application without previous referenceto Ministers (C. C. (61) 59th Conclusions, Minute ;>).2. The Chancellor of the Exchequer and the Minister ofAviation as well as the Minister of Transport and the Presidentof the Board of Trade have now sent me their replies. All areagreed that none of the economic counter-measures for whichthey would be responsible are suitable for automatic application.I accept my colleagues1 views.H.Foreign Office, S. W. 1.28th November; 1961SECRET
